title: Balliang crash: Two dead, two injured after three car crash
text:
A young boy is fighting for life after a three-car collision at Balliang, west of Melbourne, on Sunday afternoon.

Police and emergency services were called to Bacchus Marsh-Geelong Road about 1pm where three vehicles had been involved in a crash.

One man and one woman, who were in separate vehicles, died at the scene. A man was treated for non-life-threatening injuries by paramedics but a boy had to be flown to hospital where he remains in a critical condition.

Pictures from the scene show the crumpled wreckage of the cars, but the Major Collision Investigation Unit has not yet determined the cause of the crash.

The two deaths on the remote stretch of road 70km from the Melbourne CBD take this year’s statewide road toll to 225.

Anyone with information is urged to contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000.
description: A young boy is fighting for life after a three-car collision at Balliang, west of Melbourne, on Sunday afternoon.
